DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Coordinator Study Research Personnel Role Telecommunication Address ISO21090.BAG.TEL.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person who handles the administrative responsibilities of a study on behalf of the study investigator, acts as a liaison between study site and study sponsor, and reviews all data and records before a monitor's visit. EXAMPLE(S): trial coordinator, study coordinator, research coordinator, clinical coordinator, research nurse, protocol nurse. OTHER NAME(S): At some sites (primarily in academic settings) Clinical Research Coordinators are called (Clinical Research Associates) CRAs. A sequence of digits or characters used to identify a particular telephone, fax, or email of the study personnel.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Coordinator Study Research Personnel Role Telecommunication Address
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person to whom a clinical investigator delegates a few of the routine administrative requirements of a protocol. The duties and responsibilities of a clinical research coordinator may vary across different infrastructures. Generally, the coordinator manages the subject's clinical trial participation and provides a vital linkage between the subject, the investigator, and the sponsor.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:People engaged in research.:The usual or expected function of something; the part something plays in an action or event._The value for a particular telecommunication address used as the contact telecommunication information for a person or organization.
